about.title: About ICBM Law
about.description: We are a team of experienced immigration lawyers and consultants dedicated to helping you achieve your Canadian immigration goals.

page.title: About ICBM Law
page.mission_intro: Step into a world of unparalleled expertise and personalized guidance with ICBM Law, a distinguished Canadian immigration consultancy crafted to transform your aspirations of calling Canada home into reality. Founded by Moumita Chakraborty, a highly accomplished Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant (RCIC) with an MBA, and Richard Brown, a Licensed Paralegal with Law Society of Ontario and certified Immigration Consultant, our firm embodies a legacy of excellence. With over 20 years of collective experience in immigration, education, and legal services, we are your trusted partners in navigating the intricate pathways to permanent residency, family reunification, academic pursuits, or professional advancement in Canada.
page.mission_statement: At ICBM Law, we don't just process applications—we direct journeys. Our bespoke approach ensures that every client, from every corner of the globe, receives tailored solutions, unwavering support, and a seamless experience as they embark on their Canadian dream.
page.tagline: Let us guide you with precision, passion, and a commitment to your success.

features.title: Why Choose ICBM Law?
features.subtitle: We combine expertise, experience, and personalized service to make your Canadian immigration journey as smooth as possible.

expert_team.title: Expert Team

page.faq_description: Common questions about our services and the immigration process.

faq_items.question: How long does the consultation take?
faq_items.answer: Initial consultations typically last 30 minutes, allowing us to assess your situation and provide recommendations.

faq_items.question: What documents should I bring?
faq_items.answer: Bring your passport, educational credentials, work experience documents, language test results, and any previous immigration applications.

faq_items.question: Do you offer virtual consultations?
faq_items.answer: Yes, we offer secure video consultations for clients who cannot visit our office in person. Contact us to schedule your virtual meeting.

faq_items.question: What are your fees?
faq_items.answer: Our fees vary depending on the complexity of your case. We provide transparent pricing after your initial assessment and offer payment plans.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: ICBM Law ("we," "us," or "our") is committed to protecting your privacy and personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you visit our website or use our immigration consultation services.

information_collect.title: Information We Collect
information_collect.personal_info_content: We may collect the following types of personal information:
personal_info_items: Name, address, phone number, and email address
Date of birth, place of birth, and citizenship information
information_collect.technical_info_content: We automatically collect certain technical information when you visit our website, including IP address, browser type, device information, and website usage patterns through cookies and similar technologies.

how_we_use.title: How We Use Your Information
how_we_use.content: We use your personal information for the following purposes:
items: Providing immigration consultation and legal services
Preparing and submitting immigration applications
Communicating with government agencies on your behalf
Responding to your inquiries and providing customer support
Improving our services and website functionality
Complying with legal and regulatory requirements
Maintaining accurate records for professional obligations

information_sharing.title: Information Sharing and Disclosure
information_sharing.content: We may share your personal information in the following circumstances:
items: With Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) and other government agencies
With third-party service providers who assist us in delivering our services
When required by law, court order, or government investigation
With your explicit consent for specific purposes
To protect our legal rights and interests

data_security.title: Data Security
data_security.content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational security measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. This includes secure file storage, encrypted communications, and regular security assessments.

data_retention.title: Data Retention
data_retention.content: We retain your personal information for as long as necessary to provide our services and comply with legal and professional obligations. Immigration-related documents are typically retained for a minimum of seven years after the completion of your case, as required by regulatory standards.

your_rights.title: Your Rights
your_rights.content: Under Canadian privacy legislation, you have the right to:
items: Access your personal information in our possession
Request correction of inaccurate information
Withdraw consent where applicable
File a complaint with privacy authorities
Receive information about our privacy practices

cookies_tracking.title: Cookies and Tracking
cookies_tracking.content: Our website uses cookies to enhance user experience and analyze website traffic. You can control cookie settings through your browser preferences. Some features of our website may not function properly if cookies are disabled.

third_party_links.title: Third-Party Links
third_party_links.content: Our website may contain links to third-party websites. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of these external sites and encourage you to review their privacy policies.

updates.title: Updates to This Policy
updates.content: We may update this Privacy Policy periodically to reflect changes in our practices or applicable laws. We will notify you of significant changes by posting the updated policy on our website with a new effective date.

contact.title: Contact Information
contact.content: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or wish to exercise your privacy rights, please contact us:
contact.address: Address: 240 Humberline Dr, Toronto, ON M9W 5X1
contact.business_hours: Business Hours: Monday - Friday: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By accessing and using the services provided by ICBM Law, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use our services or website.

services.title: About Our Services
services.content: ICBM Law provides immigration consultation services including:
items: Immigration assessment and eligibility reviews
Application preparation and submission
Representation before Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC)
Legal advice on Canadian immigration matters
Document review and translation services
Appeal and judicial review representation

qualifications.title: Professional Qualifications
qualifications.content: ICBM Law is operated by qualified professionals:
qualifications.moumita: Moumita Chakraborty: Regulated Canadian Immigration Consultant (RCIC), License #R532939
qualifications.richard: Richard Brown: Licensed Paralegal and Certified Immigration Consultant, License #R514425
qualifications.membership: Our consultants are members in good standing with the College of Immigration and Citizenship Consultants (CICC) and/or Law Society of Ontario, as applicable.

client_responsibilities.title: Client Responsibilities
client_responsibilities.content: As our client, you agree to:
items: Provide complete, accurate, and truthful information
Respond promptly to our requests for information or documentation
Pay all fees and costs as agreed in our retainer agreement
Comply with all immigration laws and regulations
Inform us immediately of any changes in circumstances
Follow our professional advice and recommendations
Maintain confidentiality of sensitive case information

fees.title: Fees and Payment Terms
fees.content: Our fees are outlined in individual retainer agreements and may include:
items: Professional service fees
Government filing fees
Third-party costs (translations, medical exams, etc.)
Administrative and document handling fees
fees.important: Important: Fees are generally non-refundable once work has commenced. Government fees are never refundable, regardless of application outcome.

guarantee.title: No Guarantee of Success
guarantee.disclaimer: Disclaimer: While we provide professional immigration services with expertise and diligence, we cannot guarantee the success of any immigration application. Final decisions rest with Canadian immigration authorities, and outcomes depend on various factors beyond our control.

confidentiality.title: Confidentiality and Privacy
confidentiality.content: We maintain strict confidentiality regarding all client information in accordance with professional standards and privacy legislation. Client information will only be disclosed as necessary to provide services or as required by law. Please refer to our Privacy Policy for detailed information about data handling practices.

communication.title: Communication and Updates
items: Provide regular updates on case progress
Respond to client inquiries within reasonable timeframes
Maintain professional communication standards
Forward all government correspondence promptly

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.content: Our liability is limited to the fees paid for services rendered. We are not liable for indirect, consequential, or punitive damages, including but not limited to lost opportunities, emotional distress, or costs associated with application delays or refusals.

termination.title: Termination of Services
termination.content: Either party may terminate the professional relationship with reasonable notice. Upon termination:
items: You remain responsible for all fees incurred to the date of termination
We will provide your file and documents as requested
We may complete work in progress at our discretion
Confidentiality obligations continue indefinitely

disputes.title: Dispute Resolution
disputes.content: Any disputes arising from our services will first be addressed through direct communication. If unresolved, disputes may be subject to mediation or arbitration as outlined in individual retainer agreements. You also have the right to file complaints with relevant professional regulatory bodies.

governing_law.title: Governing Law
governing_law.content: These Terms of Service are governed by the laws of Ontario, Canada. Any legal proceedings will be conducted in the appropriate courts of Ontario.

changes.title: Changes to Terms
changes.content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms of Service at any time. Updated terms will be posted on our website with a new effective date. Continued use of our services constitutes acceptance of revised terms.

contact.title: Contact Information
contact.content: For questions about these Terms of Service or to discuss our services, please contact us:
contact.address: Address: 240 Humberline Dr, Toronto, ON M9W 5X1
contact.business_hours: Business Hours: Monday - Friday: 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM
contact.license_note: Licensed immigration consultants providing professional services across Canada
